channel.title: My Personal Blog
channel.description: Just a personal Blog to document random stuff in my professional and personal life.

item.title: How is my college life
item.description: Who would believe that this undocumented person from Indiana was going to get a full ride to college and would have to move to a completely…
item.content:encoded:
Who would believe that this undocumented person from Indiana was going to get a full ride to college and would have to move to a completely different state? Not me, that is for sure, as my friend was driving me to campus, which is located in Dover, Delaware, which is also an 11-hour drive. I was thinking to myself what is awaiting me, unsure of that answer, I closed my eyes and woke up right before arriving on campus. It finally hit me I am a college student now; unfortunately, my first semester of college was happening while we were in the middle of a pandemic. All of my classes were online (which sucks), but I was happy. Nonetheless, I moved into my dorm, and my college life began.

I sat there for a minute to contemplate my life and how far I have come, but my imposter syndrome decided to make an appearance, so that killed my good mood. I have met some good people on campus but because of covid-19, meeting new people was risky and limited. Anyhow, my dorm was off-campus, and since I did not have a car going to get food to the dining hall was an adventure since I either had to walk or take the shuttle or ride with a friend. The food on campus was not too bad. I did get sick from it real quick, so most of the time, I was eating a protein shake or a rice cake with peanut butter. Something good from that was that I lost some weight, which is always good since I am overweight.

My first semester went well despite the pandemic, and it came to an end two weeks before Thanksgiving because that is when I moved back home. At the end of the semester, my grades were A’s in all of my six courses, which made me feel proud of myself. Here I am in week three of my second semester of college. My goal for this semester is to have all A’s again and finally learn to program. I have created this blog to hold myself accountable for documenting my journey to learning to program and in my college career.I will try my best to become a better writer because I want to tell my story and stories from people who are experiencing the same journey as me.

item.title: How I got a full ride to college
item.description: January 2020 I was scrolling through Twitter as usual, when out of nowhere, a tweet from thedream.us appeared on my timeline. I was…
item.content:encoded:
January 2020 I was scrolling through Twitter as usual, when out of nowhere, a tweet from thedream.us appeared on my timeline. I was intrigued because the headline said, “Scholarship for undocumented students”. I immediately clicked on it that link took me to their website, where I spent a few minutes reading the scholarship requirements.

Long-story-short I started the application that day, but I thought it was too good to be true because, during that time, racism was fueled by president trump. I ended up leaving the application halfway done fast forward a few days later. I saw a tweet from thedream.us saying that it was the last day to submit the application, it was hours before the deadline, but I had to submit it because I used to work the second shift, and I knew I wouldn’t get home till midnight. So I decided to finish it and hope for the best; I wasn’t confident because I am not smart at all. I graduated high school with a 3.0 GPA and then went to community college to graduate with a 3.5 GPA. In my mind, I was like scholarships only go to recent high school graduates or really smart people (which I am neither of those two), plus I am an old soul (I was 24 at that time). Also, I wondered why a person or organization would offer an undocumented student a full ride to college?. Yeah, this is too good to be true, but I ended up submitting the application like what the hell do I got to lose? Nothing.

Anyhow, I clicked the submit button minutes before leaving to go work in a job where I was not happy at all, and most of the time, I felt depressed. Three months later, and quite honestly, I forced myself to forget about the application because I knew I wasn’t going to get the scholarship. So one day before the whole country shut down, I was on the treadmill at the gym when a notification from google Gmail popped out. This was the email I got:

When I tell you that, I immediately left the gym and headed home while one or two tears started dripping from my eyes. I cannot believe it for the first time something good happened to me in my life. I was awarded a full ride to college; never in my life would I see myself going to a four-year college mainly because I am an undocumented student, meaning that I cannot receive any financial aid. Colleges in America are too expensive. I know that first hand. After all, I struggled a lot when I went to community college because I worked a lot to make the monthly payments for the tuition barely. So, I don’t want to keep making this post longer than it should. I want to say that I am and will forever be grateful to thedream.us for giving me a chance to better my life and making me the first person in my family ever to attend college. I hope one day I can make a difference in someone’s life.I am a proud Dreamer and a proud college student from Delaware State University.

I apologize for any grammatical mistakes. I am not a good writer. I promise that I will try to better myself.

item.title: Hello Mundo
item.description: I have meant to create my first blog for the longest now, but I think today is the day that I can cross out that task from my todo-list…
item.content:encoded:
I have meant to create my first blog for the longest now, but I think today is the day that I can cross out that task from my todo-list.

This blog will hold me accountable for learning programming, which has been my goal for a while now. It will also help me document my life as a college student, and I can also upload school work here.

That is it for this first post. I do not know how many people will read this, but oh well, haber que pasa!.
